stance_1: I am concerned about my health
stance_2: I eat more chicken and fish than red meat
justification: Interviewee explicitly states concern for health motivates eating more chicken and fish instead of red meat.

stance_1: I am concerned about my health
stance_2: I eat red meat less often
justification: Interviewee explicitly states reducing red meat is due to health concerns.

stance_1: I am concerned about my health
stance_2: I try to cut back on processed meat
justification: Interviewee explicitly links reducing processed meat to health concerns.

stance_1: I am fond of chicken, turkey, and fish
stance_2: I eat more chicken and fish than red meat
justification: Interviewee explicitly mentions fondness for these meats as a reason for increasing their consumption.

stance_1: I do not control grocery shopping or meal planning
stance_2: I eat red meat less often
justification: Interviewee states lack of control over shopping and meal planning makes cutting back red meat harder.

stance_1: I do not control grocery shopping or meal planning
stance_2: I try to cut back on processed meat
justification: Interviewee states success in reducing processed meat is limited by not controlling shopping/meal planning.

stance_1: I do not control grocery shopping or meal planning
stance_2: I want to improve cholesterol and blood work
justification: Not controlling food choices conflicts with health goals like improving cholesterol.

stance_1: I do not control grocery shopping or meal planning
stance_2: I want to avoid later health problems
justification: Lack of control over food choices inhibits efforts to avoid later health problems.

stance_1: I eat more chicken and fish than red meat
stance_2: I eat red meat less often
justification: Eating more chicken/fish instead of red meat directly supports eating less red meat.

stance_1: I eat red meat less often
stance_2: I try to cut back on processed meat
justification: Cutting back on both red and processed meat are parallel actions reflecting a shared reduction effort.

stance_1: I eat red meat less often
stance_2: I want to improve cholesterol and blood work
justification: Interviewee explicitly links eating less red meat to improving cholesterol and blood work.

stance_1: I eat red meat less often
stance_2: I want to avoid later health problems
justification: Interviewee explicitly connects less red meat consumption to avoiding future health problems.

stance_1: I like hot dogs and sandwich meats
stance_2: I try to cut back on processed meat
justification: Liking hot dogs and sandwich meats conflicts with the effort to reduce processed meat.

stance_1: I make decisions based on available information
stance_2: I am concerned about my health
justification: Interviewee explicitly states health decisions are based on available information.

stance_1: I make decisions based on available information
stance_2: I want to improve cholesterol and blood work
justification: Interviewee uses information to guide efforts to improve cholesterol and blood work.

stance_1: I make decisions based on available information
stance_2: I want to avoid later health problems
justification: Interviewee uses information to guide efforts to avoid later health problems.

stance_1: I try to cut back on processed meat
stance_2: I want to improve cholesterol and blood work
justification: Processed meat reduction is implicitly linked to improving cholesterol/blood work as part of health goals.

stance_1: I try to cut back on processed meat
stance_2: I want to avoid later health problems
justification: Processed meat reduction is implicitly linked to avoiding later health problems.

stance_1: I want to avoid later health problems
stance_2: I want to improve cholesterol and blood work
justification: Improving cholesterol and blood work is explicitly mentioned as a way to avoid later health problems.
